agency_desc: A commercial organization that provides outpatient medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction utilizing methadone and buprenorphine.
service_description: Provides outpatient services to individuals who are addicted to opioids. Services include medications, counseling, and referrals to other agencies as needed. Group, individual, and family addictions counseling is available.
taxonomy_name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment,
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Addicted to or dependent on opiates

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization proving therapeutic riding and a equestrian therapy program.
service_description: Provides therapeutic riding and a equestrian therapy program for disabled individuals and children, at-risk youth, veterans, senior citizens, and individuals with a substance use disorder.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or send an email to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Individuals age three or older -- Individuals with physical disabilities -- Individuals with intellectual disabilities -- Individuals with emotional and behavioral disabilities -- Individuals with social disabilities

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable and perishable food to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: INDIANA HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY - BALANCE OF STATE CONTINUUM OF CARE
agency_desc: This is not a true agency record, but rather a collection of lead regional agencies providing coordinated entry services to individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
service_description: Leads housing intake, assessment, referrals, and placement coordination for individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
nameLevel3: At Risk/Homeless Housing Related Assistance Programs
site_details: Call the Shalom Center for information -OR - Walk in for an assessment. No appointments are available; walk-ins are seen on a first come first served basis.
site_eligibility: Serves Greene, Lawrence, Martin, Monroe, Morgan, or Owen County -- Currently and chronically homeless (living on the street, unable to obtain shelter, or living in uninhabitable conditions)

agency_desc: A program in conjunction with the Monroe County Public Library and the City of Bloomington Council for Community Accessibility that provides free mobility devices to those in need.
site_name: MOBILITY AIDS LENDING LIBRARY AT MONROE COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY
service_description: Provides free mobility aids such as canes, walkers, and wheelchairs on a temporary or permanent basis to those in need. Available equipment is dependent on donations. Limited service area.
site_details: Visit https://tinyurl.com/mallbloomingtonneed and fill out the mobility aid need form. -- Contact mallbloomington@gmail.com for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Monroe County -- In need of mobility aid equipment

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing harm reduction outreach services and recovery support in Indiana.
service_name: HARM REDUCTION SERVICES - SHALOM COMMUNITY CENTER
service_description: Offers harm reduction services, including free naloxone access, syringe access and disposal, safe sex supplies, referrals for HIV/HCV testing and treatment, and advocacy. Services are provided anonymously.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: For supplies: Walk in during designated hours. -- Visit website, send email, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing harm reduction outreach services and recovery support in Indiana.
service_description: Offers harm reduction services, including free naloxone access, syringe access and disposal, safe sex supplies, referrals for HIV/HCV testing and treatment, and advocacy. Services are provided anonymously. Services are provided anonymously.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: For supplies: Walk in during designated hours. -- Visit website, send email, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_name: INDIANA UNIVERSITY CENTER FOR RURAL ENGAGEMENT
agency_desc: An academic center of Indiana University addressing the challenges impacting Indiana communities. Services include enhancing opportunities in collaboration with communities and leading partnerships between non-land-grant, research institutions, and rural communities.
site_name: INDIANA UNIVERSITY CENTER FOR RURAL ENGAGEMENT
service_description: Collaborates with rural communities and organizations to address local opportunities and needs.
site_details: Visit website, send email, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers self-help support groups, networking and information throughout the state in which members help each other stay drug-free and share recovery experiences.
service_description: Offers self-help support groups in which members help each other stay drug-free and share recovery experiences. This area has meetings at various locations in Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, Montgomery, and Shelby County.
site_details: Call or visit website for meeting times and locations. -- Call and leave a message to receive a call-back from a recovering addict. -- All meetings are walk-in only.
site_schedule: Automated Information Line: Daily 24 Hours -- Meetings: Vary
site_eligibility: Closed Meetings: Addicts or those who think they may have a drug problem -- Open Meetings: Anyone wishing to experience narcotics anonymous fellowship

agency_desc: A nonprofit child and family advocacy agency with services throughout Indiana.
site_name: THE VILLAGES - SOUTH CENTRAL INDIANA - BLOOMINGTON
service_description: Offers statewide virtual training for persons interested in becoming licensed for foster care. Foster parents receive 24-hour staff support, counseling services, financial reimbursement, support groups, and respite care. Eligible candidates must be physically and emotionally able to handle challenges presented. Both single persons and married couples are welcome.
site_details: Visit website to complete online interest form, register for upcoming pre-service training dates, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 21 or older -- Able to pass a criminal history, child abuse, and sexual abuse registry check -- Able to meet state foster care licensing requirements

agency_desc: A non-denominational, Christian social services organization that provides goods and services to the homeless, poor, and needy.
service_description: Provides short-term emergency housing for men only and dayroom services (three daily meals and showers) for men and women.
site_details:
Day Services (Men and Women): Walk in Mon-Sun between 7am-8pm -- Women must leave at 8pm

Evening Shelter Services (Men only): Walk in Mon-Sun between 7am-9:30pm
site_schedule:
Day Services: Mon-Sun 7am-8pm -- Meals 7am, 12 noon, and 5pm

Evening Shelter Services: Mon-Sun Must arrive by 9:30pm

Evening Shelter Services: Mon-Sun Must arrive by 9:30pm

Evening Shelter Services: Mon-Sun Must arrive by 9:30pm

Evening Shelter Services: Mon-Sun Must arrive by 9:30pm
site_eligibility:
Day Services: Adult men or women -- Must be able to manage daily activities (getting dressed, eating, using the restroom, showering) without assistance 

Evening Shelter Services: Adult men -- Must be able to manage daily activities (getting dressed, eating, using the restroom, showering) without assistance -- Not listed on the sex offender registry

agency_desc: A nonprofit law firm that provides free civil legal assistance to eligible low-income people throughout Indiana. "ILS helps clients who are faced with legal problems that harm their ability to have such basics as food, shelter, income, medical care or personal safety."
service_description: Assists income-eligible taxpayers in resolving tax disputes with the Internal Revenue Service. Free legal consultation and representation may be available for tax issues such as liens and levies, exams and audits, payment plans, collection alternatives, innocent spouse relief, and tax court cases.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Primarily serves persons with household income at or below 250% Federal Poverty Level (some exceptions may apply) -- Requiring assistance with tax issues

agency_desc: Domestic Violence, Sexual Violence and Human Trafficking services. Provides emergency shelter, crisis intervention, secure housing options and supportive services to victims of domestic and sexual violence, stalking and human trafficking as well as prevention programming for youth and in-service training for gateway professionals.
service_description: Provides transitional housing for low-income domestic violence survivors and their children. Supportive services, including youth services, are available for participants. Program participation is up to 2 years.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or to request an application.
site_schedule: Office/Non-Emergency Walk-ins: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Crisis Line/Emergency Walk-ins: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Individuals age 18 or older, with children -- Homeless as a result of domestic violence -- Below 50% Area Median Income -- With a source of income within 30 days of residence

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit that provides free peer counseling support groups.
service_description: Provides free, Christian-based peer counseling for women, by women who have experienced similar problems. Counselors are not professional therapists, but are lay counselors that have gone through peer training. Areas of ministry include, but are not limited to abuse, childlessness, death, divorce, grief, eating disorders, depression, incarceration, parenting, pregnancy, self-esteem, suicide, and phobias.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit website for nearest location and call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Women and teen girls (age 13 or older)

agency_desc: A  nonprofit organization that supports residents during incarceration and in their transition back into our community.
service_description: Provides case management for ex-offenders and offenders recently released from incarceration. Services include job search assistance, referrals to community resources, hygiene items, clothing, eyeglasses, and bus tickets to job interviews or necessary appointments.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Ex-offenders

agency_name: BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA - HOOSIER TRAILS COUNCIL
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization with a strong focus on the outdoors and survival skills that aims to support young people in their physical, mental, and spiritual development so that they may play constructive roles in society.
site_name: BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA- HOOSIER TRAILS COUNCIL
service_description: Provides a business-themed program in which young men and women explore various careers and work "hands-on" with local businesses. This program is available at several sites throughout the region.
site_details: Call the council office for information about joining the nearest Exploring program.
site_eligibility: Ages 14-20

agency_desc: A public university offering four-year and post-graduate education.
service_description: Offers undergraduate and graduate degree programs in a variety of fields. This public institution is part of the Indiana University system.
site_details: Call or visit website for application information.
site_schedule: Administrative Hours: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Switchboard: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: High school diploma or high school equivalency test -- Successful application

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides food to free food pantries, community kitchens, shelters, and other member agencies. Also runs food programs distributing directly to the public, including senior food boxes and mobile pantries.
service_name: FAMILIES FIRST MOBILE FOOD PANTRY LOCATOR
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Visit agency's website to access list of mobile food pantry locations and times. Lawrence County (Bedford and Mitchell); Martin County (Shoals); and Orange County (Orleans). -- Walk in.
site_schedule: Varies by location; refer to agency's website for locations and times
site_eligibility: Living in Lawrence, Martin, or Orange County

agency_desc: A nonprofit counseling service for individuals with problems of violence or abusive behavior. Offers an Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence Certified Batterers Intervention Program.
service_description: Provides classes on recognizing and changing patterns of problematic or abusive behavior for men and women who use violence or other abusive behavior in relationships. Participants may self-refer, be court-ordered, or referred by the Department of Child Services (DCS). This 26-week program is certified by the Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence (ICADV). Clients may begin the program at any time.
site_details: Call to schedule orientation. (Persons with a court-order must attend an orientation session to meet court requirements.)
site_schedule: Men's Classes: Fri 4pm and 6:30pm -- Women: Fri noon
site_eligibility: Men and women who use violence in relationships -- Age 18 or older or age 17 or younger with parent/guardian permission

agency_name: SALT CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - MONROE COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: SALT CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - MONROE COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides basic needs assistance to those in financial crisis and high-quality early learning to low-income working families.
site_name: MONROE COUNTY UNITED MINISTRIES - SELF SUFFICIENCY CENTER
service_description: Provides up to one month's payment on rent, mortgage, or utility bill for eligible Monroe County households experiencing a temporary financial crisis. No assistance is provided through this agency for deposit or reconnection fees.
site_details: Call and select extension 15 to leave a message, including contact information. Appointments are scheduled on a call-back basis. (Note: To be eligible, clients must first have requested assistance from their township trustee.) -- Applications available online: www.mcum.org/ssc/financialassistance

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides basic needs assistance to those in financial crisis and high-quality early learning to low-income working families.
site_name: MONROE COUNTY UNITED MINISTRIES - COMPASS EARLY LEARNING CENTER
service_description: Provides high-quality and affordable early childhood education to children between the ages of 1-5. The Compass Early Learning Center is a licensed, Path to Quality level 3 early learning center. The program accepts CCDF vouchers, On My Way Pre-K, and offers a sliding-scale tuition. Compass ELC is an emergent, play-based provider that utilizes The Creative Curriculum™ and Conscious Discipline™
site_details: Applications available online: www.myprocare.com/Default/EnterEmail -- Individuals will be contacted after submitting the application when an enrollment spot becomes available. -- Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Both parents/guardians must be working or in school -- Children who are: in low-income households, in foster care, homeless, and/or from families receiving public assistance (TANF or SSI). -- Other special circumstances may be considered.

agency_desc: A nonprofit shelter for homeless families with children.
service_description: Provides an emergency shelter for single parents and couples with children. Clients receive case management and child-focused support programs.
site_details: Call for initial phone screening.
site_eligibility: Living in Monroe County -- Single parents, guardians, and couples (married, unmarried, or same-sex) with children (under age 18)

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 10am-noon; additional hours monthly 3rd and 4th Thurs 4:30pm-6:30pm
site_eligibility: Living in Monroe County -- Limit one visit every week

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call or email for information.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

service_description: Provides a smoking cessation program with individualized counseling for pregnant women. The program consists of four prenatal meetings during pregnancy and then 12 monthly meetings after delivery. Clients may select a smoking support partner, who resides with them, to enroll.  Participants who remain smoke-free after the second prenatal appointment and first year of the baby's birth may qualify for a $25 diaper voucher each month, to be redeemed at participating Walmarts. Support partners who attend monthly meetings after the baby’s birth and remain smoke free are also eligible for a $25 diaper voucher each month.

site_eligibility: Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: An agency that offers services to children and families including prevention services through the Community Partners for Child Safety program.
service_name: COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR CHILD SAFETY - REGION 13
service_description: Provides home-based case management services to help at-risk families with children overcome life challenges. The focus of this program is to strengthen families and protect children by providing preventative programs and connecting families to local resources.
site_details: Call for information; no referral necessary. -- Contact will be made by a case manager within 48 hours.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS) or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open Juvenile Probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.
